summary: This document is an email chain from November 2001 discussing Jeffrey Epstein's search for a female exercise instructor. The emails specify the instructor must be young, attractive, and willing to come to his house, with a subtext implying Epstein's known preferences. The correspondence is between individuals identified as 'G. Max' and 'Gibby'.

persons.name: G. Max
persons.role: Correspondent seeking an instructor for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, urgently requesting help from Gibby to find a young, attractive female exercise instructor for Jeffrey Epstein to come to his house.

persons.name: Gibby
persons.role: Correspondent and contact for finding an instructor
persons.context: The recipient of the request from G. Max, engaged in a back-and-forth email chain about the logistics and specifications for finding an exercise instructor for Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE', he is the subject of the search for a young, attractive female exercise instructor to come to his house, with notes about his specific preferences.

connections.description: Engaged in email correspondence where G. Max is seeking Gibby's assistance in finding a service provider (exercise instructor) for Jeffrey Epstein.
G. Max is acting on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein, communicating his specific request for a female exercise instructor.
Gibby is being asked to help find a service provider for Jeffrey Epstein, indicating a connection or prior knowledge of Epstein's requests.

events.title: Initial request for exercise instructor
events.description: G. Max emails Gibby requesting help to find a female exercise instructor for Jeffrey Epstein, specifying the instructor must be young, attractive, and come to his house.

events.title: Follow-up on instructor search
events.description: Email chain continues with G. Max noting a lack of progress in finding an instructor and Gibby jokingly declining to be counted on.

keyFacts: The email chain explicitly states Jeffrey Epstein's search criteria for an exercise instructor: female, youngish, attractive, and willing to come to his house.
The correspondence includes the phrase 'He likes, well you know what he likes,' implying the parties are aware of Epstein's known preferences.
The request also asks for recommendations for top gyms in the city and masseuses 'in the same vein,' suggesting a broader search for similar service providers.
The document date (November 2001) places this activity years before Epstein's first arrest in 2008.
